By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 06:19 am:

my henger(henger/henger) name : abi1 stat: lif456, pow999, int582, ski999,spd999,def572 age : 5 years 5 months (third generation, 1 golden peach). it was raised with my method.

my henger(henger/henger) name : abi74 stat: lif512, pow999, int482, ski999, spd999, def583 age : 5 years 1 months (second generation, i golden peach). it was raised with RNA's method

my phoenix(phoenix/phoenix) name : abi93 stat : lif583, pow353, int999, ski999, spd999, def999 age : 5 years 8 months (second generation, 1 golden peach). it was raised with a combination of RNA's method with my method

my method is similar to yours. I did many experiments. I am now in year 1432...and still no undine and niton. the diffrence is: when i win a battle, if the bonus is too small (below 10), or in a stat that i dont want (ex: i want bonus in ski, pow and speed), i will reload the game and enter the battle again.

in my inventory,, i keep 3 gemini pots, 3 sculptures, 3 dino's tails. i believe, from my experiment, that dino tails reduce stress alot.

i just sold the lump of ice, etc cause the stamina can rejuvenate with the help of nuts oil. if the monster has rested in the last week, the next month i give: (applecake, nutsoil, nutsoil, mintleaf). if not: (nutsoil, mintleaf, nutsoil, mintleaf). at prime condition: when after (frozen.battle,frozen.battle...) when after battle: -seems weel--nuts oil -well-mint leaf
i also give troron alot when my monster is still a baby and do easy drills.
ciao...

-- onomiba (abimono@mailcity.com), December 25, 1999
Just a few small points: 1) sculpture is for fatigue not stress, so if you truly want to focus on stress items dump the statues and get three more pots. 2) I understand why you would want to reset if you are maxed out, but many see this as cheating. to them I sugest stoping around 800 so that you wont go over (more or less depending on if you want to do errentries in that stat or you use hard drills incorperating that stat) 3) giving a mint leaf after battle is fairly pointless. Battles reduce stress a bunch, probabbly more than mint leaves do anyway. I generally give nuts oil regardless, but if you want to save it only for seems well weeks try a mango or candy or nothing at all, all the mint leaf is doing at that point is reducing your loyalty by a point. 4) while it may eventualy be proved that some drugs are cost effective (i.e. the life loss is worth the boost) I'm keeping away from this current trend for the time being. besides, with my intensive battling I shave more than enough off my beasties lives, thats just my personal taste though.

-- WildCard (rincewind@uswest.net), December 25, 1999.

-- onomiba (abimono@mailcity.com), December 28, 1999.

Anything that says Medicine or Stimulant is a drug (troron, kassetan, mansetan, whatever) and therefore DOES have a negative impact on lifespan. However, under certain conditions the benefits outweigh the costs (see the threads specificaly dealing with Troron and paradoxtrin for more info).

-- WildCard (rincewind@uswest.net), December 28, 1999.

I found out the Phoenixs can live 8+ years under proper raising and your use of Troron reduced its lifespan to about 5+ years. In the proper hands, Troron isn't all bad. Your phoenix was shorter lived than RNA's phoenix but are very similar in stats. All in all, a very good style. Just don't expect to make the Elder's Cup.

-- Dark Phoenix (Arax7@aol.com), December 28, 1999.

Check out "Report on the effect of TRORON" and "Drug Report: PARADOXINE" for more info on those drugs. If you used paradoxine instead of troron, your phoenix would have 200 - 400 pts more in its stats. It is much more powerful.
Our phoenix's are quite similar in stats but mine lived longer. If you had used Paradoxine, your phoenix would have much higher stats.
I also find that using (HardTrain,HardTrain,HardTrain,HardTrain) drains alot of lifespan. Maybe it's just not possible?

-- onomiba (abimono@mailcity.com), January 05, 2000.

There "probably" 2 possible reasons for your Metal Glory's short lifespan.
1) Too many battles.
2) The extra shoot drill at the end of the month has used up your existing life energy.
What is your battle record?

-- RNA (RNA@Ribosome.nuc), January 05, 2000.

154win/142KO, 2L

-- onomiba (abimono@mailcity.com), January 11, 2000.

My 3rd gen metal glory had a record of 132W 0L 118KO. It lived to be 7yrs 7m old.
Your 4th gen metal glory had a record of 154W 0L 142KO. It lived to be 6yrs 8m old.
Now this is VERY interesting!
Our battle records are about the same so it is safe to say that both our metal glories have participated in approximately the same amount of tournies.
However, your metal glory was trained with (HardTrain,HardTrain,HardTrain,LighTrain) and it lived for 6yrs 8m old.
My metal glory was trained with (HardTrain,HardTrain,HardTrain,rest) and it lived for 7yrs 7m oldm and with approx. 4 months left to live.
1 of 2 things may be the result of your metal glory's short lifespan (assuming our raising methods are approx. constant):
1) It is impossible to keep form at normal with your method of (HardTrain,HardTrain,HardTrain,LighTrain). Therefore, your metal glory's skinniness may have contributed to its short lifespan. I kept my metal glory at normal form at all times.
2) Your use of 3HT and a light train on the 4th month may follow my theory. My theory suggests that a monster has a certain amount of turns. If you are using 4 turns per month instead of 3 turns, then you are simply using up the turns faster and that would mean a shorter lifespan.
However, I am starting to believe that my theory is just a side- effect of what I now believe to be true: Any form other than "normal" results in a shorter lifespan than optimal.
Onomiba, your examples may have just proven this to be true! Your other thread, "new: TOO MUCH SLEEP MAKE YOUR MONSTER SLEEPS FOREVER" has also given evidence to support this, even though you were not looking for the answer.
I have another question: What form was your metal glory for the majority of your training? Did it always stay at normal? or did it go to skinny/slim/fat/plump alot?

-- RNA (RNA@Ribosome.nuc), January 11, 2000.

Age: 7 yrs 6 mons. (Gold Peach) 98W 0L 64KO.
